RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8 ,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EMBERLY accelerated to the lead leaving the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, drew clear at the rail midway on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. REAL APPEAL pressured the pace, dropped back off the rail midway through the turn, raced evenly in the lane and settled for second. HANDSOME JOANIE gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. WOODSONG'S CASTLE gave chase outside, raced in the four and five paths of the turn and showed little in the lane. FIFTY GRAY SHADES had a brief early lead, gave chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the three path of the turn. YESSIROFFICER gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. DIVA ROSE came away rank, stumbled to her nose and lost the rider. The Stewards posted the inquiry to review the start of this race. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Emberly
ENTRY.COMMENT: up leaving 3/8,set pressured pace,clear rail mid turn,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Real Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,dropped back off rail mid turn,settled 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOUCHDOWN MONTAGE stalked from the four path on the first turn, pulled himself to the front approaching the three eighths pole and came under pressure past the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. RAGTIME RICHES rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and settled for second while finishing evenly. CORRECTED PEDIGREE stalked in the three path the first turn, took a brief lead past the nine sixteenths pole, was met approaching the three eighths and gave chase from that point, but dropped back at the rail leaving the five sixteenths and flattened in the lane. TAKE AIM rated close two deep on the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths but flattened in the three path of the far turn. GOLDEN ADAGE rated close inside on the opening turn then faded through the backstretch. MAJOR NELSON raced in the six path on the first turn, left the turn outside and picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path, left the turn outside and showed little in the lane. ROCK ANNA ROLL took the lead and angled to the inside, was met leaving the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase from that point but faded toward the three eighths pole. MILLBANK MAN raced off the pace in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DROPKICK QUEEN rated close inside on the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, dug in for the lead past the sixteenth pole and edged clear later yards. KATALIMA settled off the pace toward the inside, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and dug in through the stretch to take second the final strides. ARROWWOOD rated close from the three path on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead past the five sixteenths, dueled clear midway on the far turn but was caught inside the sixteenth pole and flattened stride later yards. TIZBIT raced well off the pace in the two and three paths, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path, eased outside leaving the turn and showed little more. MOIRAINE angled in and took over nearing the three quarter pole and lost a shoe in the process, rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met past the five sixteenths and dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn. BOCA BIRDIE saved ground well off the pace and showed little response through the backstretch. TAPPING SOUTH raced well off the pace and off the rail on the first turn and never factored. HOVEL rounded the opening turn about the four path and never factored. SUPERSTASIA raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded through the backstretch. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Tizbit
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,2& 3p,chased 3/8,3p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Dropkick Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up past 1/16,edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Katalima
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,bid 7/16,3p far turn,up 2nd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Hovel
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormick Gloria F and O'Hara Vicki

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE'S MYBUDDYBUDDY saved ground on the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, improved at the rail on the far turn, dug in for the lead later yards and raced clear under the wire. SOMEBODY LOVES ME was hustled for early position with the lead inside but dropped back through the first turn, recovered stride leaving the half mile pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, left the turn outside and dug in to take second the final yards. GILDED QUEST rated close off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, took the lead passing the five sixteenths and drew clear leaving the quarter, but was caught flattening stride in later yards. CUT FROM CLASS took the lead two deep into the first turn and raced with the pace inside, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, was met passing the five sixteenths, dropped back at the rail into the far turn and flattened stride. BLONDE SAMARITAN raced well off the pace in the three and four paths, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. DREAM OF GOLD stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but steadied between horses at the five sixteenths pole and weakened off the rail on the far turn. ALICORN showed little response. AWESOME LUCKYCHARM dropped well back early on. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Blonde Samaritan
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3& 4p,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Somebody Loves Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead,settled 1st turn,recovered 1/2,3p far turn,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: She's Mybuddybuddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,improved rail turn,up late,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Cut From Class
ENTRY.OWNER: Keil Steven D and Keil Caitlin

ENTRY.NAME: Gilded Quest
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Richie Rich Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $ 12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVERFOLD saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and rounded the far turn in the four path, left the turn outside and dug in to take the nod under the wire. STROLLINGINTHEWIND settled two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn two deep and dug in to take a brief slim late lead, but missed the nod under the wire. I'M THE MONEY MAN saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn two deep, drifted into the lane but dug in gamely to win the nod for third. GATTO BE PROUD stalked from the two and three paths, challenged approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead at the five sixteenths and ran clear off the rail at the quarter, dug in leaving the far turn but was caught in late yards. FELICIAS CASTLE saved ground well off the pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. GRUMPY'S BUDDY saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and ran evenly in the lane. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY rounded the first turn in the five path, chased past the three eighths pole and passed rivals near the rail on the far turn. NEVERPOPTHECORK raced in the four path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase from the three eighths pole, but flattened in the four path of the far turn. I'LLTAKECAREOFIT took the lead while angling in past the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure at the three eighths, was met at the five sixteenths, dropped back at the rail into the far turn and faded through the turn. IN HIGH GEAR rounded the first turn about the four path then faded leaving the seven sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Strollinginthewind
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2d early,chased 1/2,2d far turn,brief late lead,missed nod wire

ENTRY.NAME: Neverfold
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 1/2,4p far turn,outside 1/8,nod at wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIVANA pressured the pace three wide, took the lead past the quarter pole, raced clear midway on the turn and held on under steady handling. PHANTOM QUEEN ducked out leaving the gate then set a pressured pace, was met past the quarter pole but dug in through the stretch and held on for second. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, drifted into the lane but finished well while gaining on second. COWGIRL ATTITUDE pressured the pace inside, dropped back at the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened later yards. LAURA'S GRAND gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and flattened in the lane. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path and showed little in the lane. TAPTAP chased, raced in the seven path on the turn and showed little in the lane. LADY ALDRIN gave chase and raced at the rail on the turn. ITSUPTOME was shuffled back at the start, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the four path. KYOTO KAT saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Cowgirl Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,dropped back rail 1/4,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Phantom Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,set pressured pace,met past 1/4,held on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Livana
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up past 1/4,clear mid turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since March 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MATH MAN MARCO chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted toward the top of the lane but took over leaving the eighth pole and held well with steady handling. GRUMPELSTILTSKIN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path, drifted toward the head of the lane and finished well to take second later yards. ALLEN CAN DO IT chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, angled outward toward the head of the lane and finished well. GRAND FIBER chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn then flattened late stretch. BLACK CANDY chased, raced in the six path of the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. CATS DIAMOND BOY took over leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn near the rail, was met at the eighth pole and relented. SO COURAGEOUS chased inside, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted toward the head of the lane and weakened. BE BE BOP chased toward the inside, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. FREEDOM IS RINGING exchanged contact with DAN THE MAN CAN leaving the gate, chased outside and raced wide on the turn. The latter exchanged contact with Freedom Is Ringing leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and was carried out into the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Math Man Marco
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,3p turn,drifted 6p 1/8,up past pole,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Allen Can Do It
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,angled out near 1/8,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 28, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG HAMBONE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and dug in under steady handling to get up the final yards. WIDGET FACTORY chased inside, took the lead at the rail leaving the eighth pole, dug in under steady encouragement but was caught in the final yards. IMPETUOUS set a pressured pace, raced off the rail on the turn, drifted toward the head of the lane, was met into the stretch and relented in the drive. GAMING JACK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path, eased out toward the head of the lane and finished well to pass rivals. NOMO RON chased outside, raced wide on the turn, steadied off the flank of Gaming Jack into the lane but finished well widest. NO FOOLING DUDE pressured the pace, raced close in the three path on the turn then flattened in the lane. WIZARD OF ODDS chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. MAJESTIC SEAS pressured the pace inside, dropped back at the rail approaching the quarter pole, raced close through the turn but weakened inside the eighth pole. JAIME JAMEL became fractious in the gate, came away rank then saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Hambone
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,5p turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R
